© 1998-2001 Dular, Geuzaine
 GetDP

A General Environment for the Treatment of Discrete Problems

Description GetDP is a scientific computation software for the numerical solution of integro-differential equations, using finite element and integral type methods. The main feature of GetDP is the closeness between the input data defining discrete problems (written by the user in ASCII data files) and the symbolic mathematical expressions of these problems.
Documentation Online, postscript, pdf, info, man page.
Download Version 0.77 (February 5, 2001)

Executable versions of GetDP are available for most of the classical UNIX platforms and for Windows 95/98/NT. These versions are free. The only thing asked if you use GetDP is to mention it in your work... Answers to some frequently asked questions are available here.

  • Windows zip archive (95/98/NT)
  • Linux RPM (Red Hat 6.2 and compatible, i386, glibc 2.1)
  • Linux binary (i386, glibc 2.1)
  • Digital OSF 4.0/Compaq Tru64 binary
  • Sun OS 5.5 binary
  • IBM AIX binary
  • IRIX 6.5 binary
  • HPUX 10.20 binary
Example file:
  • GetDP sample example file
Authors GetDP is developed by P. Dular and C. Geuzaine, of the Department of Electrical Engineering (ELAP) of the University of Liège. Feel free to e-mail questions, comments or bugs!
Links Gmsh is a three-dimensional meshing tool (with pre- and post-processing facilities). Written in C/C++ and using OpenGL, Gmsh can be a useful companion to GetDP for mesh generation and post-processing.
